name: SpendingLimitPeriod
description: Spending Limit Period. Defines how often a spending limit resets.

literals.description: Spending limit can be used only once and does not reset. [web:82]

name: PasskeyPermission
description: Passkey Permission. Represents a permission string granted to a passkey.

name: SignerRole
description: Role assigned to a signer in a multi-signature account. [web:84]

literals.description: Primary signer role for an account. [web:84]
Backup signer role for an account. [web:84]

name: SignerPermission
description: Permissions that can be granted to signers in a multi-signature account. [web:85]

literals.description: Signer can vote on pending transactions. [web:85]

name: CreateAccountRequest
description: Full account creation request format sent to the Grid API. This is a discriminated union that supports email accounts, signer accounts, or direct account policies. [web:86]

name: CreateAccountResponse
description: Union type representing the response from creating an account. The concrete type depends on the account creation method. [web:87]

name: KycType
description: KYC Type. Indicates whether KYC is performed for an individual or a business. [web:88]

name: KycEndorsement
description: KYC Endorsement. Indicates which payment rails the KYC is endorsed for. [web:89]

literals.description: Endorsed for ACH (Automated Clearing House) transfers. [web:89]
Endorsed for SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) transfers. [web:89]

name: Currency
description: Currency used for fees and certain operations in the Grid API. [web:90]

name: TransferState
description: State of a bridge or fiat transfer processed through Bridge payment rails. [web:91]

literals.description: Transfer has been created and is waiting for funds to arrive from the source. [web:91]
Transfer is under compliance or risk review. [web:91]
Funds have been received by the provider and are ready to be processed. [web:91]
Payment has been submitted to the destination rail (e.g. bank network). [web:91]
Payment has been fully processed and completed. [web:91]
Transfer has been canceled and will not be processed. [web:91]
An error occurred while processing the transfer. [web:91]
Transfer could not be delivered to the destination. [web:91]
Funds were returned by the destination institution. [web:91]
Transfer amount was refunded back to the sender. [web:91]

name: ConfirmationStatus
description: Confirmation status of an on-chain transaction (for example SPL transfers). [web:92]

literals.description: Transaction has been submitted but is not yet fully confirmed. [web:92]

name: TransferDirection
description: Direction of a transfer relative to the main account (inbound or outbound). [web:93]

literals.description: Funds flowed into the main account. [web:93]
Funds flowed out of the main account. [web:93]

name: TransferResponse
description: Union type representing either a Bridge transfer or an SPL token transfer. [web:94]

name: BridgeCurrency
description: Fiat currency used for Bridge-based transfers and virtual accounts. [web:95]

name: PaymentRail
description: Payment rail used for Bridge transfers, deposits, and withdrawals. [web:96]

literals.description: Transfers via a Grid smart account. [web:96]

name: ProviderSessionData
description: Provider session data as returned by the API. The API returns this as a discriminated union where the key is the provider name. [web:97]

name: AuthenticationProvider
description: Authentication provider information returned from auth completion endpoints. The API returns session data wrapped by provider type as a discriminated union (for example authentication: { "Privy": { ... } }). [web:98]
